intro: Benstonea pilaris, commonly known as the silky benstonea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in moist, tropical environments. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest in botanical studies. However, it is relatively rare and not widely cultivated.
